intro: Buckollia volubilis, commonly known as the climbing buckollia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its twining stems that allow it to climb and spread along supports. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Buckollia volubilis is native to tropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates.
